data.text:
Tremain, Rose, Wildtrack and other stories , 2010

Creator:

Tremain, Rose

Title(s):

Wildtrack and other stories / Rose Tremain ; images by Jeff Fisher.

Published/Created:

Woodbridge [England] : Full Circle Editions, 2010.

Physical Description:

79 p. : col. ill. ; 23 cm.

Holdings:

Rare Books and ManuscriptsPR6070.R36 W55 2010Yale Center for British Art, Friends of British Art Fund[Request]

Copyright Status:

Copyright Not Evaluated

Full Orbis Record:

http://hdl.handle.net/10079/bibid/9892312

Classification:

Books

Notes:

BAC: British Art Center copy is no. 16 of 100 "collectors edition" copies. Signed by Tremain and Fisher. In publisher's original slipcase.

Four short stories (from previously published collections) set in East Anglia. "At first sight these stories might seem to have little in common apart from their East Anglian setting. But some of the protagonists also share a feeling of anxiety that there is something wrong or missing in their lives which they must confront. The title story, Wildtrack, and Peerless both tackle the question of how we find meaning in a secular life, while in A shooting season the main character belives she has found a safe haven, free from interventions of any kind, but then the past makes an appearance. In Strawberry jam a young girl with a vivid imagination spies on her neighbours with disturbing results. These stories display Rose Tremain's storytelling gifts at their most beguiling."--Publisher's dust jacket.
